intro: Psychotria ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
